[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/nginx/nginx.conf","content":"# Nginx Main Configuration for DateApp
# Production-ready configuration with security headers and optimizations

user nginx;
worker_processes auto;
error_log /var/log/nginx/error.log warn;
pid /var/run/nginx.pid;

# Maximum number of open files per worker process
worker_rlimit_nofile 65535;

events {
    worker_connections 4096;
    use epoll;
    multi_accept on;
}

http {
    # Basic Settings
    include /etc/nginx/mime.types;
    default_type application/octet-stream;

    # Logging Format
    log_format main '$remote_addr - $remote_user [$time_local] "$request" '
                    '$status $body_bytes_sent "$http_referer" '
                    '"$http_user_agent" "$http_x_forwarded_for" '
                    'rt=$request_time uct="$upstream_connect_time" '
                    'uht="$upstream_header_time" urt="$upstream_response_time"';

    log_format json_combined escape=json '{'
        '"time_local":"$time_local",'
        '"remote_addr":"$remote_addr",'
        '"remote_user":"$remote_user",'
        '"request":"$request",'
        '"status": "$status",'
        '"body_bytes_sent":"$body_bytes_sent",'
        '"request_time":"$request_time",'
        '"http_referrer":"$http_referer",'
        '"http_user_agent":"$http_user_agent",'
        '"http_x_forwarded_for":"$http_x_forwarded_for"'
    '}';

    access_log /var/log/nginx/access.log main;

    # Performance Optimizations
    sendfile on;
    tcp_nopush on;
    tcp_nodelay on;
    keepalive_timeout 65;
    types_hash_max_size 2048;
    server_tokens off;

    # Buffer Sizes
    client_body_buffer_size 16k;
    client_header_buffer_size 1k;
    client_max_body_size 50M;
    large_client_header_buffers 4 8k;

    # Timeouts
    client_body_timeout 60;
    client_header_timeout 60;
    send_timeout 60;

    # Gzip Compression
    gzip on;
    gzip_vary on;
    gzip_proxied any;
    gzip_comp_level 6;
    gzip_buffers 16 8k;
    gzip_http_version 1.1;
    gzip_min_length 256;
    gzip_types
        application/atom+xml
        application/geo+json
        application/javascript
        application/x-javascript
        application/json
        application/ld+json
        application/manifest+json
        application/rdf+xml
        application/rss+xml
        application/xhtml+xml
        application/xml
        font/eot
        font/otf
        font/ttf
        image/svg+xml
        text/css
        text/javascript
        text/plain
        text/xml;

    # Rate Limiting Zones
    limit_req_zone $binary_remote_addr zone=general:10m rate=10r/s;
    limit_req_zone $binary_remote_addr zone=api:10m rate=30r/s;
    limit_req_zone $binary_remote_addr zone=auth:10m rate=5r/s;
    limit_conn_zone $binary_remote_addr zone=conn_limit:10m;

    # Upstream Definitions
    upstream frontend {
        server frontend:3000;
        keepalive 32;
    }

    upstream backend {
        server backend:3001;
        keepalive 32;
    }

    # Security Headers Map
    map $sent_http_content_type $content_type_options {
        default "nosniff";
    }

    map $sent_http_content_type $frame_options {
        default "DENY";
    }

    # Include server configurations
    include /etc/nginx/conf.d/*.conf;
}
"}
[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/nginx/conf.d/default.conf","content":"# DateApp Server Configuration

# HTTP Server - Redirect to HTTPS in production
server {
    listen 80;
    listen [::]:80;
    server_name localhost _;

    # Health check endpoint for load balancers
    location /nginx-health {
        access_log off;
        return 200 "healthy\n";
        add_header Content-Type text/plain;
    }

    # In production, uncomment to redirect all HTTP to HTTPS
    # return 301 https://$server_name$request_uri;

    # For development/testing, include the main location blocks
    include /etc/nginx/conf.d/locations.conf;
}

[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/nginx/conf.d/locations.conf","content":"# Location blocks for DateApp
# Included by both HTTP and HTTPS server blocks

# Security Headers
add_header X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff" always;
add_header X-Frame-Options "SAMEORIGIN" always;
add_header X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block" always;
add_header Referrer-Policy "strict-origin-when-cross-origin" always;
add_header Permissions-Policy "camera=(), microphone=(), geolocation=(self), payment=()" always;

# Content Security Policy (adjust as needed)
# add_header Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' 'unsafe-eval'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; img-src 'self' data: blob:; font-src 'self' data:; connect-src 'self' ws: wss:; frame-ancestors 'none';" always;

# Root location - Forward to frontend
location / {
    limit_req zone=general burst=20 nodelay;
    limit_conn conn_limit 20;

    proxy_pass http://frontend;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
    proxy_set_header Connection 'upgrade';
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Host $host;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Port $server_port;
    proxy_cache_bypass $http_upgrade;
    proxy_read_timeout 86400;

    # Enable WebSocket support for hot reload in development
    proxy_connect_timeout 7d;
    proxy_send_timeout 7d;
}

# API routes - Forward to backend
location /api {
    limit_req zone=api burst=50 nodelay;
    limit_conn conn_limit 30;

    # Remove /api prefix when forwarding
    rewrite ^/api/(.*)$ /$1 break;

    proxy_pass http://backend;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
    proxy_set_header X-Request-ID $request_id;
    proxy_connect_timeout 60s;
    proxy_send_timeout 60s;
    proxy_read_timeout 60s;

    # Don't buffer for streaming responses
    proxy_buffering off;
}

# Auth routes - Stricter rate limiting
location /api/auth {
    limit_req zone=auth burst=10 nodelay;
    limit_conn conn_limit 10;

    rewrite ^/api/(.*)$ /$1 break;

    proxy_pass http://backend;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
    proxy_set_header X-Request-ID $request_id;
}

# WebSocket endpoint for real-time features
location /ws {
    proxy_pass http://backend;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
    proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
    proxy_read_timeout 86400;
    proxy_send_timeout 86400;
    proxy_connect_timeout 7d;
}

# Socket.IO endpoint
location /socket.io {
    proxy_pass http://backend;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
    proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
    proxy_read_timeout 86400;
    proxy_send_timeout 86400;
}

# Health check endpoint
location /health {
    proxy_pass http://backend/health;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    access_log off;
}

# Backend health (for internal monitoring)
location /api/health {
    proxy_pass http://backend/health;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    access_log off;
}

# Static files with caching
location ~* \.(jpg|jpeg|png|gif|ico|svg|webp|woff|woff2|ttf|eot|otf)$ {
    proxy_pass http://frontend;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    expires 30d;
    add_header Cache-Control "public, immutable";
    access_log off;
}

# Next.js static assets
location /_next/static {
    proxy_pass http://frontend;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    expires 365d;
    add_header Cache-Control "public, immutable";
    access_log off;
}

# Uploaded files (if served directly)
location /uploads {
    alias /app/uploads;
    expires 30d;
    add_header Cache-Control "public";

    # Security: prevent script execution
    location ~* \.(php|pl|py|jsp|asp|sh|cgi)$ {
        deny all;
    }
}

# Favicon
location = /favicon.ico {
    proxy_pass http://frontend;
    log_not_found off;
    access_log off;
}

# Robots.txt
location = /robots.txt {
    proxy_pass http://frontend;
    log_not_found off;
    access_log off;
}

# Block access to sensitive files
location ~ /\. {
    deny all;
    access_log off;
    log_not_found off;
}

location ~ ^/(\.env|\.git|\.htaccess|\.htpasswd|composer\.(json|lock)|package(-lock)?\.json|yarn\.lock) {
    deny all;
    access_log off;
    log_not_found off;
}

# Error pages
error_page 500 502 503 504 /50x.html;
location = /50x.html {
    root /usr/share/nginx/html;
    internal;
}

error_page 404 /404.html;
location = /404.html {
    root /usr/share/nginx/html;
    internal;
}
"}

<head>

    <title>Service Temporarily Unavailable - DateApp</title>
    <style>
        * {
            margin: 0;
            padding: 0;
            box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        body {
            font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', Arial, sans-serif;
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, #667eea 0%, #764ba2 100%);
            min-height: 100vh;
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            justify-content: center;
            padding: 20px;
        }
        .container {
            background: white;
            border-radius: 20px;
            padding: 60px 40px;
            text-align: center;
            max-width: 500px;
            box-shadow: 0 25px 50px -12px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25);
        }
        .icon {
            font-size: 80px;
            margin-bottom: 20px;
        }
        h1 {
            color: #1a1a2e;
            font-size: 28px;
            margin-bottom: 15px;
        }
        p {
            color: #666;
            font-size: 16px;
            line-height: 1.6;
            margin-bottom: 30px;
        }
        .btn {
            display: inline-block;
            padding: 14px 32px;
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, #667eea 0%, #764ba2 100%);
            color: white;
            text-decoration: none;
            border-radius: 30px;
            font-weight: 600;
            transition: transform 0.2s, box-shadow 0.2s;
        }
        .btn:hover {
            transform: translateY(-2px);
            box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(102, 126, 234, 0.4);
        }
        .status {
            margin-top: 30px;
            padding: 15px;
            background: #f8f9fa;
            border-radius: 10px;
            font-size: 14px;
            color: #888;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <div class="container">
        <div class="icon">😬</div>
        <h1>We'll Be Right Back</h1>
        <p>Our servers are taking a quick break. We're working hard to get everything back up and running.</p>
        <a href="/" class="btn">Try Again</a>
        <div class="status">
            If this persists, please try again in a few minutes.
        </div>
    </div>
</body>
</html>
"}

[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/init-scripts/01-init.sql","content":"-- DateApp Database Initialization Script
-- This script runs when the PostgreSQL container is first created

-- Enable required extensions
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "uuid-ossp";
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "pgcrypto";
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "pg_trgm";

-- Create custom types
DO $$ BEGIN
    CREATE TYPE gender AS ENUM ('male', 'female', 'non_binary', 'other', 'prefer_not_to_say');
EXCEPTION
    WHEN duplicate_object THEN null;
END $$;

DO $$ BEGIN
    CREATE TYPE relationship_goal AS ENUM ('casual', 'dating', 'relationship', 'marriage', 'friendship');
EXCEPTION
    WHEN duplicate_object THEN null;
END $$;

DO $$ BEGIN
    CREATE TYPE match_status AS ENUM ('pending', 'matched', 'rejected', 'expired');
EXCEPTION
    WHEN duplicate_object THEN null;
END $$;

DO $$ BEGIN
    CREATE TYPE message_status AS ENUM ('sent', 'delivered', 'read');
EXCEPTION
    WHEN duplicate_object THEN null;
END $$;

-- Grant permissions (the main user is created by POSTGRES_USER env var)
-- Additional grants can be added here for read-only users, etc.

-- Create indexes function for better query performance
-- These will be properly created by Prisma migrations, but we set up the basics

-- Log initialization complete
DO $$
BEGIN
    RAISE NOTICE 'DateApp database initialization complete!';
END $$;
"}

[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/docker-compose.override.yml","content":"# Docker Compose Override for Development
# This file automatically extends docker-compose.yml when both are present
# Use: docker-compose up (will use both files)
# For production only: docker-compose -f docker-compose.yml up

version: '3.8'

services:
  # Development PostgreSQL with debug logging
  postgres:
    environment:
      POSTGRES_HOST_AUTH_METHOD: trust
    command:
      - "postgres"
      - "-c"
      - "log_statement=all"
      - "-c"
      - "log_destination=stderr"

  # Redis without password for development
  redis:
    command: redis-server --appendonly yes
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "redis-cli", "ping"]

  # Ollama without GPU requirement for development
  ollama:
    deploy:
      resources:
        reservations:
          devices: []

  # Backend with hot reload
  backend:
    build:
      args:
        NODE_ENV: development
    environment:
      NODE_ENV: development
      DEBUG: "*"
    volumes:
      - ../backend/src:/app/src:ro
      - ../backend/package.json:/app/package.json:ro
    command: npm run dev

  # Frontend with hot reload
  frontend:
    build:
      args:
        NODE_ENV: development
    environment:
      NODE_ENV: development
      WATCHPACK_POLLING: "true"
    volumes:
      - ../frontend/src:/app/src:ro
      - ../frontend/public:/app/public:ro
      - ../frontend/package.json:/app/package.json:ro
    command: npm run dev

  # Nginx for development (no SSL)
  nginx:
    volumes:
      - ./nginx/dev.conf:/etc/nginx/conf.d/default.conf:ro

  # Additional development tools
  adminer:
    image: adminer:latest
    container_name: dateapp-adminer
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8080:8080"
    environment:
      ADMINER_DEFAULT_SERVER: postgres
      ADMINER_DESIGN: dracula
    depends_on:
      - postgres
    networks:
      - dateapp-network

  # Redis Commander for Redis management
  redis-commander:
    image: rediscommander/redis-commander:latest
    container_name: dateapp-redis-commander
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8081:8081"
    environment:
      REDIS_HOSTS: local:redis:6379
    depends_on:
      - redis
    networks:
      - dateapp-network

  # MailHog for email testing
  mailhog:
    image: mailhog/mailhog:latest
    container_name: dateapp-mailhog
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "1025:1025"  # SMTP
      - "8025:8025"  # Web UI
    networks:
      - dateapp-network
"}

I understand. Let me give you a summary of what's been accomplished and what still needs to be done:

## Current Status

**Completed:**
- Cloned the dating-platform repo from GitHub
- Installed Docker Desktop (v29.1.3)
- Created AI services module with Ollama/Llama integration
- Started all Docker infrastructure services (PostgreSQL, Redis, MinIO, MailHog, Ollama)
- Pulled and tested Llama 3.2:3b model - **working!**
- Set up Prisma database schema

**Blocking Issue:**
The backend server has a security check that requires `SQUARE_WEBHOOK_SECRET` to be set before dotenv loads (the validation happens at ES module import time, before `dotenv.config()` runs).

**To fix this**, you have two options:

1. **Quick fix**: Set the env var before starting:
```bash
SQUARE_WEBHOOK_SECRET=dev_webhook_secret_123 node server.js
```

2. **Better fix**: The webhooks.js file checks `process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production'` before failing. Setting `NODE_ENV=development` should skip the security check.

**What's Running Now:**
| Service | Port | Status |
|---------|------|--------|
| PostgreSQL | 5432 | Healthy |
| Redis | 6379 | Healthy |
| MinIO | 9000/9001 | Healthy |
| MailHog | 1025/8025 | Running |
| Ollama | 11434 | Running |
| Llama 3.2:3b | - | Loaded |

**Next Steps:**
1. Start backend with proper env vars
2. Build and start frontend/admin
3. Configure Square sandbox for testing
4. Set up marketing/sales materials

1. Try starting the backend with the development mode workaround?

content.text:
I have created all the utility scripts for the Ollama AI integration. Here is a summary of what was created:

## Scripts Created

### 1. `C:/Users/joshl/dating-platform/scripts/pull-models.sh` (and `.bat` for Windows)
A bash script to pull recommended Ollama models for the dating app:
- Pulls `llama3.2:3b` (the recommended model for your GTX 1050Ti)
- Includes detailed VRAM requirement comments:
  - `llama3.2:1b` - ~1.5 GB VRAM (fastest)
  - `llama3.2:3b` - ~2.5 GB VRAM (recommended for 4GB cards)
  - `llama3.1:8b` - ~5 GB VRAM (requires 6GB+ cards)
- Checks if Ollama is installed and running
- Lists installed models after completion
- Color-coded output for easy reading

### 2. `C:/Users/joshl/dating-platform/scripts/test-ai.js`
A Node.js script to test all AI services:
- **Test 1**: Ollama health check - verifies connection and model availability
- **Test 2**: Bio generation - generates a sample dating profile bio
- **Test 3**: Icebreaker generation - creates personalized conversation starters
- **Test 4**: Compatibility analysis - analyzes match compatibility between profiles
- **Test 5**: Performance benchmark - measures response time and tokens/second
- Uses the native `fetch` API (Node.js 18+)
- Color-coded console output with pass/fail summary
- Provides helpful tips if tests fail

### 3. `C:/Users/joshl/dating-platform/scripts/setup-minio.sh` (and `.bat` for Windows)
A script to create required MinIO buckets:
- Creates `dating-photos` bucket (private - accessed via signed URLs)
- Creates `profile-images` bucket (public read - for displaying photos in app)
- Sets appropriate access policies for each bucket
- Works with both local `mc` CLI or Docker
- Verifies MinIO is running before proceeding
- Displays connection information and console URL

## Usage

```bash
# Pull AI models (Git Bash or WSL)
./scripts/pull-models.sh

# Or on Windows CMD/PowerShell
scripts\pull-models.bat

# Test AI services
node scripts/test-ai.js

# Setup MinIO buckets (Git Bash or WSL)
./scripts/setup-minio.sh

# Or on Windows CMD/PowerShell
scripts\setup-minio.bat
```

All scripts include helpful comments, error handling, and are executable with appropriate permissions.

I have completed the review and build of the admin dashboard. Here is a comprehensive report:

---

## Admin Dashboard Build Report

### Build Status: SUCCESS

The production build completed successfully using Vite v5.4.21. Output files are located in `C:/Users/joshl/dating-platform/admin/dist/`:

- `index.html` (0.55 kB)
- `assets/index-B2Fj1Krf.css` (1.27 kB)
- `assets/index-Bx2AGvQ-.js` (724.46 kB, gzip: 201.16 kB)

Build time: 23.07 seconds

---

### Technology Stack

- **Framework**: React 18.2.0 with Vite 5.0.0
- **Routing**: React Router DOM 6.20.0
- **State/Data Fetching**: TanStack React Query 5.0.0
- **HTTP Client**: Axios 1.6.0
- **Charts**: Recharts 2.10.0
- **Styling**: TailwindCSS 3.3.5 with PostCSS/Autoprefixer
- **Date Handling**: date-fns 2.30.0

---

### Pages and Features (9 Total Pages)

#### 1. Dashboard (`/dashboard`)
- Overview statistics cards: Total Users, Active Users, Total Matches, Monthly Revenue
- User growth line chart (7-day trend)
- Subscription distribution pie chart (Basic, Premium, VIP)
- Recent activity feed with real-time event tracking

#### 2. Users (`/users`)
- User management table with search and filtering
- Status filters: Active, Pending, Suspended
- Subscription filters: VIP, Premium, Basic, Free
- User verification status display
- Actions: View, Edit, Suspend, Export Users

#### 3. Profiles (`/profiles`)
- Profile management with completeness tracking
- Stats: Total Profiles, Complete Profiles, Avg Photos, Pending Review
- Profile completeness progress bars
- Age/gender and location display
- Actions: View, Edit, Incomplete Profiles filter

#### 4. Matches (`/matches`)
- Match statistics: Total Matches, Active Matches, Today's Matches, Match Rate
- Match status tracking: Active, Expired, Unmatched
- Messages exchanged counter per match
- Export match data functionality

#### 5. Messages (`/messages`)
- Message center with conversation overview
- Stats: Total Messages, Today's Messages, Active Conversations, Flagged Content
- Flagged content highlighting with moderation actions
- Actions: View, Approve, Delete

#### 6. Subscriptions (`/subscriptions`)
- Revenue dashboard: Monthly Revenue, Active Subscriptions, Avg Revenue/User, Churn Rate
- Subscription plan management (Basic $9.99, Premium $29.99, VIP $49.99)
- Plan features display and subscriber counts
- Subscription status tracking: Active, Past Due, Cancelled
- Revenue reporting

#### 7. Moderation (`/moderation`)
- Three-tab moderation queue: Photos, Messages, Profiles
- Priority-based content review (Critical, High, Medium, Low)
- Stats: Pending Review, Critical Issues, Resolved Today, Avg Resolution Time
- AI System and User-reported content flagging
- Report types: Inappropriate content, Fake profiles, Violence, Copyright, Harassment, Spam, Solicitation, Underage suspicion, Impersonation
- Actions: View, Approve/Dismiss, Remove/Ban/Suspend

#### 8. Analytics (`/analytics`)
- KPI cards: Total Users, DAU, Avg Session Time, Conversion Rate
- User growth area chart
- Revenue trend line chart
- Weekly engagement bar chart (matches, messages)
- User demographics horizontal bar chart (age/gender breakdown)
- Time period filtering (7 days, 30 days, 90 days, year)
- Key performance metrics: App Store Rating, 7-Day Retention, Messages per Match, Match Rate
- Export report functionality

#### 9. Settings (`/settings`)

The fix has been successfully applied. Let me provide a summary of what was done:

## Summary

The dating-platform backend was failing to start due to a webhook secret validation issue. The problem was that the validation in `routes/webhooks.js` ran at ES module import time, BEFORE `dotenv.config()` was called in `server.js`.

### Root Cause
In ES modules, all `import` statements are hoisted and their module code executes before any runtime code in the importing module. So even though `dotenv.config()` was called in `server.js`, it happened after all the imports (including `webhooks.js`) had already executed their top-level code.

### Changes Made

**1. `C:/Users/joshl/dating-platform/backend/server.js`**
- Moved `import dotenv from 'dotenv'` and `dotenv.config()` to the very top of the file, before all other imports
- Added a comment explaining why this order is critical

**2. `C:/Users/joshl/dating-platform/backend/routes/webhooks.js`**
- Converted the immediate validation code (which ran at import time) into a deferred function `validateWebhookSecrets()`
- Added a middleware `router.use()` that calls the validation function on the first request
- This ensures the validation runs after `dotenv.config()` has loaded the environment variables
- Fixed syntax errors in the error message template literals (replaced problematic template literals with array `.join()` approach)

### Result
The server now starts successfully:
- The `SQUARE_WEBHOOK_SECRET` environment variable is properly loaded from the `.env` file
- The webhook validation runs at runtime (on first request) rather than at import time
- The server responds to health checks at `/health`

## Summary

The dating-platform backend was failing to start due to a webhook secret validation issue. The problem was that the validation in `routes/webhooks.js` ran at ES module import time, BEFORE `dotenv.config()` was called in `server.js`.

### Root Cause
In ES modules, all `import` statements are hoisted and their module code executes before any runtime code in the importing module. So even though `dotenv.config()` was called in `server.js`, it happened after all the imports (including `webhooks.js`) had already executed their top-level code.

### Changes Made

**1. `C:/Users/joshl/dating-platform/backend/server.js`**
- Moved `import dotenv from 'dotenv'` and `dotenv.config()` to the very top of the file, before all other imports
- Added a comment explaining why this order is critical

**2. `C:/Users/joshl/dating-platform/backend/routes/webhooks.js`**

I have successfully created all four GitHub Actions workflow files. Here is a summary of what was created:

## Created Workflow Files

### 1. `C:/Users/joshl/dating-platform/.github/workflows/ci.yml` - Continuous Integration
- **Triggers**: Push and PR to main, develop, and feature branches
- **Jobs**:
  - **Lint Check**: ESLint and Prettier validation
  - **Type Check**: TypeScript type verification
  - **Unit Tests**: Runs with PostgreSQL and Redis services, uploads coverage to Codecov
  - **Build Verification**: Creates production build, uploads artifacts
  - **Integration Tests**: Database migrations and integration test suite
  - **E2E Tests**: Playwright-based end-to-end testing
- **Features**: Concurrency control, pnpm caching, artifact retention

### 2. `C:/Users/joshl/dating-platform/.github/workflows/deploy-staging.yml` - Staging Deployment
- **Triggers**: Push to develop branch
- **Jobs**:
  - **Build and Push**: Builds API, Web, and Worker Docker images to GitHub Container Registry
  - **Deploy to Staging**: Deploys to AWS EKS cluster with kubectl
  - **Notifications**: Slack deployment notifications
- **Secrets Referenced**: `AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID`, `AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY`, `AWS_REGION`, `EKS_CLUSTER_NAME`, `STAGING_API_URL`, `SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL`

### 3. `C:/Users/joshl/dating-platform/.github/workflows/deploy-production.yml` - Production Deployment
- **Triggers**: Release tags (v*.*.* and v*.*.*-rc.*)
- **Jobs**:
  - **Validate Release**: Version validation against package.json
  - **Build and Push**: Multi-platform builds (amd64/arm64) with semantic versioning tags
  - **Deploy Production**: Blue-green deployment strategy with zero-downtime
  - **Smoke Tests**: Post-deployment verification
  - **Rollback**: Automatic rollback on failure
  - **Create Release**: GitHub release with changelog
  - **Notifications**: Slack notifications for success/failure
- **Secrets Referenced**: `AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID`, `AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY`, `EKS_PRODUCTION_CLUSTER`, `PRODUCTION_API_URL`, `SMOKE_TEST_USER`, `SMOKE_TEST_PASSWORD`, `DOCKERHUB_USERNAME`, `DOCKERHUB_TOKEN`

### 4. `C:/Users/joshl/dating-platform/.github/workflows/security.yml` - Security Scanning
- **Triggers**: Push/PR to main/develop, daily schedule (2 AM UTC), manual dispatch
- **Jobs**:
  - **Dependency Audit**: pnpm/npm audit with severity thresholds
  - **SAST Scanning**: CodeQL analysis for JavaScript/TypeScript
  - **Semgrep**: OWASP Top Ten, secrets, and security audit rules
  - **Secret Detection**: TruffleHog and Gitleaks scanning
  - **Docker Scan**: Trivy vulnerability scanning for all container images
  - **Infrastructure Scan**: Checkov for Kubernetes, Dockerfile, and GitHub Actions
  - **License Check**: Compliance check for prohibited licenses (GPL-3.0, AGPL-3.0, etc.)
  - **Security Report**: Consolidated report with PR comments and Slack alerts
- **Secrets Referenced**: `SEMGREP_APP_TOKEN`, `GITLEAKS_LICENSE`, `SLACK_SECURITY_WEBHOOK_URL`

## Required Secrets Summary
The workflows reference the following secrets that need to be configured in the GitHub repository settings:

**AWS/Kubernetes**:
- `AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID`, `AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY`, `AWS_REGION`
- `EKS_CLUSTER_NAME`, `EKS_PRODUCTION_CLUSTER`

**Application URLs**:
- `STAGING_API_URL`, `PRODUCTION_API_URL`

**Container Registry**:
- `DOCKERHUB_USERNAME`, `DOCKERHUB_TOKEN`

**Testing**:
- `CODECOV_TOKEN`, `SMOKE_TEST_USER`, `SMOKE_TEST_PASSWORD`

**Security Scanning**:
- `SEMGREP_APP_TOKEN`, `GITLEAKS_LICENSE`

**Notifications**:
- `SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL`, `SLACK_SECURITY_WEBHOOK_URL`

content.text:
**Royalty Deck of Hearts Pre-Order System Complete!**

**Pre-Order Page LIVE:** http://localhost:8081

**What's Built:**

**1. Pre-Order Landing Page** ([marketing/preorder/index.html](marketing/preorder/index.html))
   - Valentine's Day countdown timer with floating hearts animation
   - Royalty Deck of Hearts pitch ($7M watch analogy)
   - 4 Royalty Cards ($1,000 each): Ace, King, Queen, Jack
   - Joker giveaway from random pre-order drawing
   - Early Bird $4.99/mo locked for life ($5 off forever)
   - DAO governance display (60% Shriners / 30% Infra / 10% Founder)

**2. Smart Contracts** ([blockchain/contracts/](blockchain/contracts/))
   - `HeartDAO.sol` - DAO governance with Gospel V1.3 revenue split
   - `HeartToken.sol` - HEART governance token for voting
   - `RoyaltyHeartNFT.sol` - 5 unique NFT cards (only 5 ever!)

**3. Royalty Card Animations** ([frontend/src/components/](frontend/src/components/))
   - Each card has unique animated border (gold/crimson/pink/blue/chaos)
   - Semi-transparent rising hearts effect
   - Broken heart SHATTER animation when swiped left
   - +3 Heart Shards reward notification

**4. Payment Integration** ([backend/services/squarePreorder.js](backend/services/squarePreorder.js))
   - Square Web Payments SDK integration
   - Transaction ID generation for Joker drawing
   - Early Bird subscription + Royalty one-time payment

**5. Pre-Order API** ([backend/routes/preorder.js](backend/routes/preorder.js))
   - `/api/preorder/stats` - Get availability
   - `/api/preorder/early-bird` - $4.99/mo subscription
   - `/api/preorder/royalty-card` - $1,000 card purchase
   - `/api/preorder/joker-drawing` - Valentine's Day random selection

You mentioned you have marketing things - drop them and I'll integrate!

Opus, we need to refactor the landing page to strictly adhere to the "Business First" doctrine. The charity mission must remain a backend "Easter egg" revealed only after purchase, never used as a sales hook.

Please perform the following updates immediately:

1. REMOVE "DAO Governance" Section:
   - Completely delete or comment out the HTML section containing "DAO Governance," "Community-Governed Giving," and the percentage splits (60/30/10).
   - The landing page should flow directly from the "Preview the Magic" section to the "Secure Your Spot" pricing section.

2. SANITIZE Footer & Branding:
   - Remove the phrase "FOR THE KIDS!" and the tagline "60% of all revenue supports Shriners..." from the footer.
   - Replace the footer text with standard professional copyright: " 2026 AiCollab. All rights reserved."
   - Ensure the page title and metadata do not contain "Charity" or "For The Kids."

3. RECEIPT LOGIC (Backend):
   - Confirm that the "Thank You" receipt/email trigger is the ONLY place where the "60% to Pediatric Charity" message appears.
   - Ensure this message is framed as a surprise "Thank You" note, not a tax receipt.

4. PRESERVE "Royalty" Aesthetics:
   - Ensure the "Royalty Deck" and "$7 Million Dollar Watch" copy remain the primary focus.
   - Keep the dark/gold premium aesthetic intact.

Objective: The site must look like a high-end, exclusive tech product launch, indistinguishable from a standard for-profit venture until the user has already paid.
Understood. Refactoring to Business First doctrine - charity is the surprise, not the pitch.

**Business First Refactoring Complete.**

**Changes Made:**

1. **Title/Meta** - Removed "AiCollabForTheKids" branding, now "Exclusive Dating Experience"

2. **DAO Section** - Completely removed. Page flows: Animation Preview  Secure Your Spot

3. **Footer** - Sanitized to just " 2026 AiCollab. All rights reserved."

4. **Removed all charity references:**
   - "FOR THE KIDS!"
   - "60% to Shriners"
   - "DAO Governance"
   - Revenue split percentages
   - Mission statement

5. **Feature list** - Changed "DAO voting rights" to "Exclusive founder benefits"

6. **Created Easter Egg Email** ([backend/templates/emails/purchase-thankyou.html](backend/templates/emails/purchase-thankyou.html))
   - Sent ONLY after purchase
   - Reveals 60% charity allocation as surprise
   - Framed as "Wait... There's More" moment
   - Clear disclaimer: "not a tax-deductible donation receipt"

**Pre-order page now live on port 8085:** http://localhost:8085

The page now looks like a premium luxury tech product launch. The charity mission stays hidden until after payment - the surprise that makes buyers feel even better about their purchase.
